name: Hadamard manifold
summary:
In mathematics, a Hadamard manifold, named after Jacques Hadamard — more often called a Cartan–Hadamard manifold, after Élie Cartan — is a Riemannian manifold 
  
    
      
        (
        M
        ,
        g
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle (M,g)}
  
 that is complete and simply connected and has everywhere non-positive sectional curvature. By Cartan–Hadamard theorem all Cartan–Hadamard manifolds are diffeomorphic to the Euclidean space
